From: Tim Brennan=20
Sent: Wednesday, June 01, 2005 1:58 PM
To: all
Subject: thank the gods! now maybe we can do it too!!!

=20

=20

"Microsoft Will Drop 'My' Prefix for Longhorn"

http://www.technewsworld.com/story/hardware/43450.html

=20

If you are a Microsoft <http://www.microsoft.com/>  (Nasdaq: MSFT) =20
<http://www.technewsworld.com/perl/search.pl?query=3DMicrosoft&scope=3Dne=
two
rk> user, there's a big change coming in Longhorn -- the code name for
the next MS operating system: the "My" prefix is disappearing.

Microsoft users have become used to the "My Music," "My Pictures," and
other "My" folders, the Seattle Post-Intelligencer, reported. Those
Windows folders will still be yours -- but they won't keep hitting you
over the head with that terminology.

Ending a longstanding tradition, Microsoft says, starting in the next
Windows version due out next year, folders will be known simply as
"Documents," "Music," and so on.

The "My" prefix was apparently an attempt to create a personal
connection between people and their computers at a time when the idea of
using a computer might have been forbidding.

The technique seems especially outdated now that computers and
technology have become such a normal part of everyday life, Naomi Baron,
an American University <http://www.american.edu/>  =20
<http://www.technewsworld.com/perl/search.pl?query=3D%22American%20Univer=
s
ity%22&scope=3Dnetwork> linguistics professor told the =
Post-Intelligencer.

Baron is writing a book called "Beyond E-mail: Language in the New
Millennium."=20

=20
